document.docAuthor: Albornoz-Garzón, Juan G., Conde-Saldaña, Cristhian C., García-Melo, Jorge E., Taphorn, Donald C. & Villa-Navarro, Francisco A.
document.docTitle: Creagrutus dulima Albornoz-Garzón & Conde-Saldaña & García-Melo & Taphorn & Villa-Navarro 2018, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Creagrutus (Characidae: Stevardiinae) from the upper Río Magdalena, Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Creagrutus (Characidae: Stevardiinae) from the upper Río Magdalena, Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Creagrutus cf. paralacus
(non Harold & Vari): Harold & Vari, 1994 :15-16 (Río Magdalena at Sasaima);
Conde-Saldaña et al., 2017
:4 (ecomorphology; diet; altitudinal range; Colombia , Departamento Tolima , Río Alvarado; CZUT-IC 10246).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Creagrutus brevipinnis
(non Eigenmann):
Maldonado-Ocampo et al ., 2005
: 66
(in part: CZUT-IC 632);
Villa-Navarro et al. , 2006
: 9
(in part: CZUT-IC 174).

CZUT-IC 17663 , 70.9 MM SL, COLOMBIA , DEPARTAMENTO TOLIMA , IBAgUÉ, UPPER RÍO MAgDALENA DRAINAgE, QUEBRADA CHUMBA , 04°29'06"N , 75°05'49"W , 973 MASL ; C. C. CONDE-SALDAÑA & J. G. ALBORNOZ-GARZÓN,
13 DECEMBER 2012
.

Not types :
ALL FROM
COLOMBIA
, DEPARTAMENTO
TOLIMA
, RÍO MAgDALENA DRAINAgE: CZUT-IC 632 (51, 40.2–70.3 MM SL), IBAgUÉ, BRIDgE OVER RÍO COMBEIMA , ROAD IBAgUÉ-TOTUMO. APPROXIMATELy 04°23'40"N , 75°11'06"W , 930 MASL ; CZUT-IC 2624 (66, 49.0–62.9 MM SL), VENADILLO , RÍO TOTARE , 04°41'47"N , 74°59'24"W , 620 MASL ; CZUT-IC 4750 (26, 41.6–72.0 MM SL), RONCESVALLES , RÍO CUCUANA , 04°1'33"N , 75°28'17"W , 1376 MASL ; CZUT-IC 10469 (21, 12.4–55.8 MM SL), IBAgUÉ, RÍO ALVARADO , 04°27'37"N , 75°07'45"W , 909 MASL ; CZUT-IC 10497 (21, 2 C&S, 12.4–55.8 MM SL), IBAgUÉ, QUEBRADA COCARE , 04°28'37"N , 75°08'25"W , 1057 MASL ; CZUT-IC 10837 (21, 3 C&S, 12.4–55.8 MM SL), IBAgUÉ, QUEBRADA CHUMBA , 04°29'06"N , 75°05'48"W , 973 MASL ; CZUT-IC 15999 (1 C&S, 52.1 MM SL), IBAgUÉ, QUEBRADA CHEMBE , 04°27'34.2"N , 75°08'54.7"W , 988 MASL

Diagnosis .
Creagrutus dulima
DIFFERS FROM ALL TRANS-ANDEAN CONgENERS, EXCEPT
C. paralacus
, IN HAVINg A SMALLER EyE DIAMETER (21.8–26.8% HL) (VS. 28.6–39.8% HL IN
C. affinis
, 27.1–34.7% HL IN
C. magdalenae ,
27.2– 29.7% HL IN
C. guanes ,
30.6–34.9% HL IN
C. brevipinnis
, 31.3–35.6% HL IN
C. nigrostigmatus
, 30.2–38.3% HL IN
C. maracaiboensis
, 30.4–35.0% HL IN
C. hildebrandi
AND 29.4–33.3% HL IN
C. caucanus
).
Creagrutus dulima
DIFFERS FROM
C. paralacus
IN HAVINg SHORT HOOKS ON THE PELVIC-FIN RAyS (VS. LONg HOOKS , FIg. 2B ) AND IN HAVINg A DARK RETICULATED PATTERN ON THE DORSUM (VS. A ROW OF MELANOPHORES ALONg DORSAL MIDLINE ).

Creagrutus dulima
FURTHER DIFFERS FROM THE OTHER TRANS-ANDEAN SPECIES By THE FOLLOWINg COMBINATION OF CHARACTERS: THE ABSENCE OF A SPOT OR DARK STRIPE ALONg THE MIDDLE CAUDAL-FIN RAyS (VS. MIDDLE CAUDAL-FIN RAyS WITH DARK SPOT OR STRIPE IN
C. affinis
, C.
maracaiboensis
,
C. nigrostigmatus
AND
C. hildebrandi
); LATERAL LINE COMPLETE (VS. INCOMPLETE IN
C. maracaiboensis
); ABSENCE OF LAMELLAR PROCESS THAT COVERS LATERAL-LINE PORES (VS. LAMELLAR PROCESS PRESENT IN
C. caucanus
); LONgER POSTORBITAL DISTANCE (43.1–53.9% SL) (VS. 30.3–41.9% SL IN
C. affinis ,
33.6–39.5% SL IN
C. brevipinnis ,
38.0–41.3% SL IN
C. nigrostigmatus
, AND 35.2–41.0% SL IN
C. hildebrandi
); SHORTER PREDORSAL LENgTH (44.6–50.3% SL) (VS. 53.3–55.8% SL IN
C. nigrostigmatus ,
AND 52.2–55.7% SL IN
C. maracaiboensis
) AND SHORTER DISTANCE BETWEEN DORSAL AND ANAL FINS (26.9–33.2 % SL) (VS. 34.9–41.3% SL IN
C. magdalenae
); AND SHORTER DISTANCE BETWEEN DORSAL AND PELVIC FINS (22.8–30.4% SL) VS. (30.2–33.2% SL IN
C. nigrostigmatus
); AND THIRD INFRAORBITAL NOT IN CONTACT WITH PREOPERCLE (VS. IN CONTACT WITH PREOPERCLE IN
C. affinis
,
C. brevipinnis
,
C. caucanus
,
C. hildebrandi
,
C. magdalenae
,
C. maracaiboensis
AND
C. nigrostigmatus
).

Creagrutus dulima
DIFFERS FROM ITS CIS-ANDEAN CONgENERS, EXCEPT FOR
C. changae
,
C. figueiredoi
,
C. flavescens
,
C. gephyrus
,
C. gracilis
,
C. hysginus
,
C. magoi
,
C. meridionalis
,
C. occidaneus
,
C. paraguayensis
,
C. petilus
,
C. runa
AND
C. xiphos By
ITS COLORATION PATTERN . THE NEW SPECIES CAN BE DISTINgUISHED FROM
C. changae
,
C. figueiredoi
,
C. flavescens
,
C. gephyrus
,
C. gracilis
,
C. hysginus
,
C. magoi
,
C. meridionalis
,
C. occidaneus
,
C. paraguayensis
,
C. petilus
,
C. runa
AND
C. xiphos
IN HAVINg A SMALLER EyE (21.8–26.8% HL VS.> 28.4% HL).

Description. MORPHOMETRIC AND MERISTIC DATA ARE gIVEN IN
TABLE 1
. BODy ELONgATE. GREATEST BODy DEPTH SITUATED AT VERTICAL THROUgH DORSAL-FIN ORIgIN. DORSAL PROFILE CONVEX FROM TIP OF SUPRAOCCIPITAL SPINE TO DORSAL-FIN ORIgIN; NEARLy STRAIgHT AND POSTEROVENTRALLy SLANTED FROM LATTER POINT TO ADIPOSE FIN , AND CONCAVE FROM LATER POINT TO ANTERIORMOST PROCURRENT CAUDAL-FIN RAyS. VENTRAL PROFILE OF BODy SLIgHTLy CONVEX FROM ISTHMUS TO ANAL-FIN ORIgIN; ANAL-FIN BASE STRAIgHT; STRAIgHT TO SLIgHTLy CONCAVE FROM BASE OF LAST ANAL-FIN RAy TO PROCURRENT CAUDAL-FIN RAyS. SOME SPECIMENS WITH PAPILLAE PRESENT ON BODy.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Morphometric values for the holotype and paratypes of
Creagrutus dulima
. n= number of specimens; S.D= standard deviation.

subSubSection.paragraph: HEAD ROBUST, ITS DORSAL PROFILE CONVEX FROM MARgIN OF UPPER LIP TO VERTICAL THROUgH POSTERIOR MARgIN OF POSTERIOR NOSTRILS, THEN STRAIgHT FROM LATTER POINT TO END OF SUPRAOCCIPITAL SPINE; INTERORBITAL REgION TRANSVERSELy FLAT; VENTRAL PROFILE OF HEAD SLIgHTLy CONVEX TO ANTERO-VENTRAL CORNER OF DENTARy, THEN STRAIgHT TO ISTHMUS.

MOUTH SUBTERMINAL, UPPER jAW CONSPICUOUSLy PROTUDINg BEyOND LOWER jAW; OUTER ROW OF PREMAXILLARy TEETH SLIgHTLy EXPOSED IN VENTRAL VIEW. CORNER OF MOUTH LOCATED AT HORIZONTAL LINE THAT CROSSES BELOW VENTRAL MARgIN OF EyE. PREMAXILLA WITH THREE SERIES OF TRICUSPID TEETH: FIRST ROW IRREgULAR, WITH 5(4) TEETH OF EQUAL SIZE THAT FORM AN ARC; SECOND ROW WITH A CLUSTER OF 3(4) TEETH, LARgER THAN TEETH FROM THE FIRST ROW, AND THIRD ROW WITH SINgLE 1(4) TOOTH, SLIgHTLy THINNER THAN REMAININg TEETH, LOCATED NEXT TO THIRD TOOTH FROM FIRST ROW. MAXILLA WITH 3(2) OR 4(2) TRICUSPID TEETH, OF EQUAL SIZE. DENTARy WITH 5(2) OR 6(2) TRICUSPID TEETH, ANTERIORMOST THREE TEETH LARgER THAN REMAININg TEETH. FIRST BRANCHIAL ARCH WITH 3(3) OR 4(1) gILL RAKERS ON HyPOHIAL, 7(1) OR 8(3) gILL RAKERS ON CERATOBRANCHIAL, AND 8(3) OR 9(1) gILL RAKERS ON EPIBRANCHIAL.

SCALES CyCLOID, circuli RESTRICTED TO ANTERIOR PART OF SCALES, WITH 18–20 WAVy radii , THAT EXTEND PARALLEL FROM SCALE CENTER TO ITS POSTERIOR MARgIN. LATERAL LINE SLIgHTLy CURVED, WITH 35(1), 36(20), 37*(24) OR 38 (19) PORED SCALES. FOUR (13) OR 5*(52) SCALES BETWEEN DORSAL-FIN ORIgIN AND LATERAL LINE; 3*(41) OR 4 (24) SCALES BETWEEN LATERAL LINE AND PELVIC-FIN INSERTION. PREDORSAL SCALES 10(4), 11(24), 12*(22), 13(13), OR 14(2).

Color in alcohol. BODy LIgHT BROWN, DORSAL REgION WITH DARK RETICULATED PATTERN FORMED By PIgMENTATION CONCENTRATED ON DISTAL PORTION OF SCALES; HUMERAL BLOTCH RELATIVELy FAINT, VERTICALLy ELONgATED, EXTENDINg LONgITUDINALLy FROM SECOND TO FOURTH SCALE OF LATERAL LINE. PLUMBEOUS, RELATIVELy BROAD MIDLATERAL STRIPE STARTINg AT FIRST SCALE OF LATERAL LINE, EXTENDINg TO BASE OF CAUDAL PEDUNCLE. ABDOMINAL AREA LIgHT BROWN. DORSAL REgION OF HEAD, UPPER LIP, AND ANTERIOR THIRD OF MAXILLA LIgHT gRAy; VENTRAL AND DORSAL MARgINS OF ORBIT DARK; PREOPERCLE AND OPERCLE SILVERy. FINS WITH FEW MELANOPHORES ( FIg. 1 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Creagrutus dulima ,
CZUT-IC 17663, holotype, 70.9 mm SL, Colombia, Departamento Tolima, Ibagué, upper Río Magdalena drainage, quebrada Chumba.

FIGURE 2. Pelvic-fin hooks in A:
Creagrutus dulima
, CZUT-IC 17666, 66.9 mm SL, B:
Creagrutus paralacus
, CZUT-IC 17667, 50.6 mm SL.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution.
Creagrutus dulima
IS KNOWN FROM TRIBUTARIES OF THE UPPER RÍO MAgDALENA BASIN AT THE
EASTERN
SLOPES OF THE CENTRAL ANDEAN CORDILLERA , DEPARTAMENTO
TOLIMA
,
COLOMBIA
( FIg. 4 ), FROM SITES RANgINg BETWEEN 623–1376 MASL .

Etymology. “DULIMA” IS AN INDIgENOUS WORD OF THE PIjAO ETHNIC gROUP, WHICH MEANS RIVER OF SNOW OR RIVER OF CLOUDS , AND REFERS TO THE SNOW-COVERED
TOLIMA
MOUNTAIN PEAK , WHICH IS A SyMBOL OF THE DEPARTMENT OF
TOLIMA
, ONE OF THE MOST ECOLOgICALLy THREATENED IN
COLOMBIA
. A NOUN IN APPOSITION .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Creagrutus dulima
, CZUT-IC 18773, paratype, 92.9 mm SL, living specimen immediately before preservation, in dark (A) and white (B) backgrounds.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ecology. THE TyPE LOCALITy OF
Creagrutus dulima
IS A STREAM WITH AN AVERAgE WIDTH OF 4.4M, WITH SUBSTRATE COMPOSED By SAND , PEBBLES AND ROCKS , AND ABUNDANT RIPARIAN VEgETATION ( FIg. 5 ). PHySICAL AND CHEMICAL PARAMETERS OF THE WATER AT THE TIME OF COLLECTION OF THE HOLOTyPE ARE : TEMPERATURE 21.6 °C, DISSOLVED OXygEN 6.94 Mg O2/L, PH 8.27, CONDUCTIVITy 162.23 µS/CM, NITRATES 1.14 Mg/L, PHOSPHATES 2.91 Mg/L AND TOTAL SOLIDS 150.5 Mg/L. SPECIMENS OF
C. dulima
WERE COLLECTED ASSOCIATED WITH RAPIDS , AND WERE FOUND SyNTOPICALLy WITH
Bryconamericus tolimae
(EIgENMANN, 1913),
Hemibrycon
SP.,
Chaetostoma
CF. fischeri (STEINDACHNER, 1879),
Trichomycterus banneaui
(EIgENMANN, 1912),
Trichomycterus
SP.,
Astroblepus grixalvii
(HUMBOLDT, 1805),
Astroblepus
CF. unifasciatus (EIgENMANN, 1912),
Astroblepus homodon
(REgAN, 1905),
Cynodonichthys magdalenae
(EIgENMANN & HENN , 1916) AND
Poecilia reticulata
(PETERS, 1859). STOMACH CONTENTS OF 17 SPECIMENS INCLUDED A HIgH

PROPORTION OF AQUATIC INSECTS OF THE FAMILIES BAETIDAE , BLEPHARICERIDAE , HyDROPSyCHIDAE , CHIRONOMIDAE AND PSyCHODIDAE , AS WELL AS TERRESTRIAL INSECTS ( FORMICIDAE , COLEOPTERA , AND HyMENOPTERA ), AND PIECES OF SEEDS AND UNIDENTIFIED ORgANIC AND INORgANIC MATERIAL.
